entries.meaning: (biology) The pronged plater used in frogging (transferring cells to another plate).
(colloquial) A person interested in frogs; a herpetologist who specialises in frogs; a frog enthusiast.

description: From Frogger, a 1981 arcade game developed by Konami, in which the player directs frogs across a busy road and other hazards.

verbs.description: frogger (third-person singular simple present froggers, present participle froggering, simple past and past participle froggered)

entries.meaning: (slang) To dodge traffic while navigating across a busy road.
